title: Auguste Ménégaux
text:
Henri Auguste Ménégaux (17 May 1857 – 15 July 1937) was a French <a href="ornithology">ornithologist</a> and <a href="malacology">malacologist</a> born in <a href="Audincourt">Audincourt</a>. He was based at the <a href="Mus%C3%A9um%20national%20d%27histoire%20naturelle">Muséum national d'histoire naturelle</a> in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>. From 1910, with <a href="Louis%20Denise">Louis Denise</a> (1863-1914), he was publisher of the <a href="scientific%20journal">journal</a>, "Revue Française d'Ornithologie Scientifique et Pratique".
In 1899 he supported his graduate thesis at the <a href="Sorbonne">Sorbonne</a> with a dissertation on marine <a href="bivalves">bivalves</a> titled "Recherches sur la circulation des Lamellibranches marins". In 1901 he replaced <a href="Eug%C3%A8ne%20de%20Pousargues">Eugène de Pousargues</a> (1859-1901) as assistant to <a href="%C3%89mile%20Oustalet">Émile Oustalet</a> (1844-1905) at the Muséum national d'histoire naturelle (mammals and birds). Later he became deputy director of the laboratory headed by <a href="%C3%89douard%20Louis%20Trouessart">Édouard Louis Trouessart</a> (1842-1927).
His studies included birds collected by the French Antarctic Expedition commanded by <a href="Jean-Baptiste%20Charcot">Jean-Baptiste Charcot</a> (1867-1936). In 1912 he became a founder of the "Ligue pour la Protection des Oiseaux" (League for the Protection of Birds).
